net.foxycorndog.thedigginggame.actor

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.thedigginggame.actor.Actor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Player

    public class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that keeps the information for any Actor type. Such information includes the location, speed, size, and other states.
    Since:
    Feb 22, 2013 at 4:23:30 AM, v0.1
    Version:
    Feb 22, 2013 at 11:32:08 PM, v0.1
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor(Map map,
     int width,
     int height,
     float speed,
     float jumpHeight)
        Creates an actor with the specified characteristics.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to add the actor to.
        width - The width of the sprite of the Actor.
        height - The height of the sprite of the Actor.
        speed - The speed of the actor when walking.
        jumpHeight - The height in which the Actor can jump.

    • Method Detail

      • isFocused

        public boolean isFocused()
        Returns:
        Whether this Actor is focused on.

      • setFocused

        public void setFocused(boolean focused)
        Set whether this Actor is to be focused on. Centers the Actor on the screen any time it is moved.
        Parameters:
        focused - Whether or not to focus the Actor.

      • center

        public void center()
        Centers the Actor in the screen.

        Returns:

               float y)

        Parameters:

        y - The vertical component to set.

      • move

        float dy)
        Move the Actor the specified amount on the Map.
        Parameters:
        dx - The displacement horizontal component.
        dy - The displacement vertical component.

      • tryMove

        public boolean tryMove(float dx,
              float dy)
        Attempt to make a move in the direction that the specified values express.
        Parameters:
        dx - The horizontal magnitude in which to try to move.
        dy - The vertical magnitude in which to try to move.
        Returns:
        Whether or not a move was successful.

        Move the Actor to the left at the rate of the Actor's speed.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the Actor was able to move left.
